It's the end of a saga that lasted nearly 3 years.  In fact tomorrow would of been Geoff's and my third anniversary if we had managed to stick it out. Instead last night just before the fireworks I confronted him with Jenn, the girl he cheated on me with for months. And boy was he up shit creek without a paddle. She called me on Thursday night after a bunch of messages via myspace we spent 3 and a half hours talking and put together a timeline of when he was cheating on both of us. So we decided to confront him last night, and we did so spectacularly. I finally put into words just how much I hate him and actually loathe him which I find to be worse and I told him if he ever thinks about calling me or emailing me again I will have a restraining order put on him because he is out of my life for good. He made me think I was going crazy with all the lies he would tell me, and the lies he would tell her.  He was doing the same exact thing. There was nothing he could say to defend himself so he just said well now that you two have each other I'm leaving. It felt so damn good to watch him good. Emotionally I'm just like hell yea! My life is turning around for the better. I feel it every day.

Someone I can be myself 100% and be totally comfortable. That's such a rarity to find these days. And guys in Boston don't leave me with much hope but I'm sure I'll find someone someday.

Oooh I like this topic! This week has been a huge reading week for me. I finished A Fine Balance by Rhonin Mistry FINALLY! Then I read and finished The Road by Cormac McCarthy on Friday and now I'm reading Kushiels Justice by Jacqueline Carey, needed something more or less lighthearted after reading those first two.

A Fine Balance. This was a supremely well written book, that during the first 30 pages or so I really didn't like it since it was just so damn depressing. And it is a depressing book, but there is an upside to it all then it drops right back down again to misery.  But honestly its a story of the humanity and how life comes full circle, no matter what we do to rise above it, there is always something to beat us back down. Key example Dina, happy willful child, with an a strict older brother Nusswan, their father dies and Nusswan becomes man of the house. Now Dina is expected to fit into the mold of a perfect little angel, he refuses to let her have friends and has her taking care of their mother, and the housework, so her grades suffer. And as a consequence he pulls he from school. Though good for her she rejects all the men he brings to the house to marry her off to and actually marries the man she loves. Though tragedy strikes again when he passes away on their 3rd anniversary so now she battles loneliness and supporting herself through a myriad of ways, and through these enter three men. Maneck, Om, and Ishavar, all with sad sad stories of their own. Now no longer lonely, but not sure on how to interact with these men they live and learn together and things become better. But the struggles of these people are incredible. I recommend this for anyone who can stomach such a strong tale. Once you become invested in the characters its a book its hard to put them down.

The Road
I would of waited to read this one if I didn't have to give it back to my co-worker - again another depressing book. Its in the midst of a nuclear winter and everything is dead, its not sure how long its been a nuclear winter, and for the main characters it seems to have been a long time. The child seems to know nothing different than what is currently though he is ten, and apparently the mother and wife died a long time ago. They head to the coast in order to find what is not clear. Blue water, the good guys, something. People are desperate, resorting to cannibalism to survive. The father and son spend a good deal of time alone, though the son has a tender heart wanting to share what they have with others, while the father obviously more practical says those people are going to die anyways and then when we are starving you'll wish we kept the food. This was a tale that tore at the heart strings and knowing that in this day in age it could happen at anytime. Nuclear War will destroy the earth and will humanity survive to see the world reclaim itself?

Kushiels Justice
Back to the realm of fantasy, of mystery and intrigue, of love and loss and pissing off the Queen! Gotta love pissing off a queen.....I won't go so far into this one because I have friends who have yet to read the second Kushiel Trilogy!

Now for the rest of the books that I have yet to read. I just ordered a couple of new ones from paperbackswap.com. One is The Professor and the Madman: A Tale of Murder, Insanity, and Making of the Oxford English Dicitionary, and the other is a cook book, Healthy Indian Cooking. Samosas anyone???? =) But I also have a few books being sent this way. One is entitled Quarter Life Crisis and Eye of the World by Robert Jordan, I am going to attempt one last time to read his series the Wheel of Time and hopefully make it through all of the books this time.

Friends, maybe its not exactly friends but I just don't understand the games people play. In fact I find the dull and wearisome. I was sharing some text messages with a friend earlier, and this is what they amounted to more or less.

There is a major wildfire going on in Idaho right now and its shameful that today is the first time I have seen any mention of that on the news or in the papers or anything. My cousin lives in Idaho in Sun Valley where he works and the first mention of it was a tiny little paragraph in Boston Now, and then in the Metro all there was was a picture of a firefighter and the blaze behind him with a teeny little caption. Both mention that the fire is going up the west side of Bald Moutain and heading into Sun Valley. Since Sun Valley Resort is where all the happy rich people go, it finally merits a teeny tiny little mention. Sometimes this country just sucks when it comes to reporting about our own! I haven't talked to my cousin in  few days so I'm hoping that everyone has been evacuated.

Ok I just checked out whats going on in some papers online and Sun Valley hasn't been touched yet though a good portion of one of the mountains is now charred. I'm still a little worried though and hope that they contain this sooner rather than later.

Several articles this morning caught my attention:

TWO TEENS SHOT NEAR STATE HOUSE
Ok this one here isn't anything new. Though it was quite different to walk down Tremont St, the length of Boston Common and seeing a huge chunk of it cordoned off with crime scene tape. Two teenagers were sitting on a park bench on Sunday night when a guy flipped out because he thought they were talking to him and started shooting wildly. One of the bullets broke a window of the state house. 

" The governor is deeply disturbed by any acts of violence in the commonwealth and is particularly upset with one that caused a bullet to break a window at the State House." Patrick spokeswoman Cyndi Roy said.

I laughed when I read this, he is particularly upset by a broken window?? I would be more upset that more people are getting shot, and maybe this is a wake up call to get the government to wake up and do something about all the gun violence in this city. This place is becoming fairly dangerous thats for sure, despite measures to do something about it, it just seems to be getting worse as time goes on. Though it seems like most of the violence is in the poorer sections of town, its spreading to the more affluent areas, and is only going to continue to spread. 

OBESITY RATES SHOW NO DECLINE
This one rates its own section especially since I was talking to Abhi about it last night. Mississippi became the firest state to break the 30% barrier of obese adults. And the highest percent of children ages 10 to 17 is in the District of Columbia.

I find this to be so frustrating not just as a national epidemic but also in my personal life. I've always fought with my weight and the feelings of frustration, helplessness, and depression that go along with it. Fortunately the solution is quite simple when it comes to losing weight and being healthier. Eat appropriately and get enough exercise to start burning all of it off. Easy Peasy. I wish it were so, I've never been overly motivated to do get off my ass and do something and when I do, all of the negative feelings come crashing down and I feel like crap about it and end up giving it up in the end. It seems pointless to walk and not go anywhere on a treadmill, I can't think of anything more annoying that going to a gym and feeling like a rat in a cage trying to go somewhere but ending up nowhere.

So my patience is waning on all fronts. I'm tired of waiting for the state to make me a permanent employee yet. My friends and family keep getting frustrated with the situation, more so than I am I think. I'm a patient person what can I say, but theres just so much a person can take and its annoying as hell since I've been here for a year and still nothing has changed and its even worse now because all of the paperwork has been submitted and still no word from HR about being permanent. Sigh! This is only part of my patience that is waning, the other is my relationship status, I'm tired of being single. This isn't a rant or anything else just a statement of fact, I want to get married and have a family, this has always been my number one goal, more so than my career. I often feel like I have been born into the wrong century. I have to admit to a certain amount of envy when I see families out and about, especially when those people are my age. My friend Elise, married 3 kids, the oldest just started school a week ago, and she and her husband run a ranch out in Montana!  My dream life, with the exception that I'm allergic to horses!

Gotta love having an allergist appointment first thing in the morning, especially when they are testing for what your allergic to. But the first thing the doctor says to me this morning is "You have to get rid of your cats." I politely said "thats not a possiblity" what I really wanted to say is "ARE YOU SMOKING  CRACK?!?!?!?!"  The doctor was nice I do have to give him that, but that is the worst possible way to start off a conversation with me. Besides if I wanted to get rid of my cats I couldn't. Honestly though if for some reason that I am not able to keep Mittens she is to go back to Cathy, the woman I got her from. But having to find a new home for Precious would be next to impossible - he's such a little hellion that I wouldn't be able to place and more than likely would have to have him put down. I DON'T THINK SO! And if Mittens went away I would hate to think on how miserable he would become. So guess what the kitties are staying put! So there.

But on the other downside I have to make a ton of changes to the way my home is and I know I'm not going to get any help from my roommates regarding this. The biggest one is to my bedroom, I'm allergic to dustmites (this is a new one) and the best way to combat them is to wash all of bedding once a week in hot water, and to cover the bed, box spring, and pillows with a cover that is hypoallergenic and doesn't allow the mites into the bed. Of course this shit is expensive. So essentially I need to live in a bubble. What really stinks is that I wanted to get a down comforter, and I'm allergic to feathers. Visting my parents house is going to be a  pain in the ass, as they have a bird, cat, and dog, and my dad smokes like a chimney! Thankfully none of these critters go into the guest room.

Less than 45 minutes to go in the day. Pierre was in Augusta the last time I called him - so he should be here before 6 or 7. Though he is going to hit some crazy rush hour type stuff. But on top of seeing a good friend, I can't wait because he is bringing cross stitch stuff from Mary  and I now have a lot of books to read - super exciting. Life is good at the moment. I'm happy for now.

Hope all is going well in the rest of the world with all the happy people!

No this is not meant in a good way. Today just started out in the most annoying way possible. After a great night last night. We had one of our book club meetings and this time we had a bunch of new people join us and the group dynamic is wonderful. A couple of my friends joined, as well as some other people and we just had wonderful conversation even though we didn't read a book for this month. But our book for next month is A Fine Balance by Rhonin Mistry, so far its pretty depressing. So after leaving around 9 so I could get some grocery shopping done.  I went to sleep around midnight. And was woken up at 4:15a due to my roommate leaving the kitchen light on. So after going back to bed I ended up having the weirdest dream......

I'm standing at a snack machine, somewhere in the world goodness only knows where, and the guy who plays Clayton Webb on JAG (Steven Culp) was standing behind me and telling me that he needs me to go with him to pick up a person of a sensitive nature. So I leave with him, and we drive to Logan, and we pick up this guy dressed all in black and wearing a black hood over his head. Strange very strange I think I'm watching to many espionage type stuff lately. We get the guy to the car and Steven Culp says to me uwrap your gift. Ok I know what you guys are thinking now. But I pull off the hood and its Abhi. Ohhhh-K. He is obviously not very happy at this point. So fastforward and we're sitting in what I assume to be my apartment. We're sitting cozily on opposite ends of the couch with glasses of wine and laughing and talking and having a great time, but every time we try to move to get closer we can't and so we stay at our own ends and talking. I know it doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure this one out. 

The alarm went off at 6:30 and I didn't get out of bed at 7:20. So I'm running late, I get to the bus stop on time, and the bus is running late. When the bus does finally come its almost 8:30 and I have to be to work at 8:45. Yikes. But the best ride into Boston was just horrible. There was a woman with twin boys at least 3 or 4 years old and HYPER. So they're yelling and screaming and she's yelling at them and pinching them when they won't sit still. Like that is going to teach them anything! She was pinching them and twisting and I just felt like going up to her and doing it to her. She was hurting and scaring her children, the only thing she accomplished was them fearing her. And if she is pinching them like that in public what is she doing behind closed doors? I know this is only one instance, but I hate to see children terrified, I grew up like that, and its not easy and it makes life harder as an adult thats for sure and the pattern continues. My friend Mel is a key example. Her parents berated her and yelled at her, and who knows what and she is doing the same thing to Emily calling her a little brat and screaming at her. Its horrible. I feel like telling her why don't you try a different approach and see what happens. Children are not meant to be angels and as adults we sometimes give them reasons to act out - but we can change that and most of my friends see that,  thankfully!
But on top of the kids screaming and acting out on the bus, there were two women who are at least my mothers age comparing their breast sizes LOUDLY. Not a conversation to behaving that loudly in a public place no matter what your age. And the final straw was this Asian girl who was wearing a very full back pack. I'm sitting in my seat, and she is forced to lean back into me because she and her friend refused to walk to the back of the bus to make more room in the front. So people are pushing by her and she keeps leaning into my lap and hitting me with her bag. Common courtesy is to take the bag off and put it on the floor out of the way so there is room for everyone. People in this city just don't get it sometimes.

So by the time I got to work I was pretty cranky and its almost time to go home and I find myself still venting about all of this. oh well time to go ttyl

I know there are hundreds if tens of thousands of other college graduates out there who can't make ends meet. But I still feel like I am losing my mind. Alexandra Robbins wrote a book called Quarter Life Crisis. Yeah thats my life a quarter life crisis. Well since I need to organize my thoughts just going to switch to the old stand by questionnaire. Amazing how it allows me to answer whats going on in my head without it becoming a jumbled mess. That I can do with my journal at home.

I See:  Besides the daunting pile of CQE's (data entry stuff for work) that are beside me on my desk and that this is a nice summery color for today, I don't see much. I'm between and rock and a hard place and I can't seem to find my way out. Or at least I don't see one at the moment. I owe money and I have absolutely no money. Well I take that back I have $20 to get me through till next Wednesday when I get paid again.  But today I am able to pay my landlady $200 not by choice and my rent is $550 per month! I got a bank check so that my landlords can cash it with no problem. That way they can get their money and I can get caught up and I can stop avoiding them out of shame.  As I said I'm 26 years old and I can't do a god damn thing!
I Need: A lobotomy? To relieve some of this pressure in my head.  Monday and Tuesday were just horrible, when I needed my family the most to be supportive they tell me don't worry about it. Don't worry about it? WTF! My student loans went into default on June 13, 2007 and I'm not supposed to worry about it? I have a chance to rehabilitate my loans but in order to do that I need to come up with $605.00 before July 15. I don't see that happening either lol. When my apartment got broken into all I wanted was some time with people who love me and can help make things better and my dad told me to stop running from my problems. Running from my problems? I didn't know wanting love and support was running away. When I told my parents I wanted to get back into therapy - my dad told me to take karate lessons to focus my life. I start therapy today at noon time. 
I Find: That to quote my earlier self - being an adult sucks. I may not have had the best childhood growing up, but anything is preferable to the way things are going right now. That I am more frustrated than not when it comes to my friends and I am more than grateful that they put up with me in my current state. I called Hope and Rhonda the other night and they helped bail me out of trouble this week. My electricity was going to be shut off yesterday I paid the damn bill last week, but due to a mess stemming from the break in, the check bounced. Long story short, computer stolen (had account info on it), so opened a new bank account had $300+ in said bank account. The old account was still waiting for checks to clear, which over drew the old account, so the bank took it upon themselves to transfer the $300+ into the old account in an attempt to bring it current but all they did was leave both accounts in a negative state. I was finally able to close my old account, but I can't do anything with the new one cause its still negative and what little money I get I need to cash and hand out to the people I owe. Talk about frustrating.
I Want: A lot of things the first and foremost is to go and entire day without thinking about my money issues. To actually have a normal life where I don't have to worry about where every little penny is going. . . . .

Ok I just got back to work from visiting a therapist who was EXTREMELY helpful! Unfortunately I won't be seeing her because I can't afford the $25 per week. But she did have some suggestions and other places for me to go to get help.  Its amazing what was accomplished in an hour. Nothing life affirming or life changing but just helpful suggestions. And honestly it feels good to take a proactive approach which I haven't for the longest time. Its not going to be easy but then again what is? So to continue where I left off

. . . . .I want to achieve my goals and get out of this rut that is my life. I want to be a registered dietician, I want to help people. But as they say you can't help anyone till you help yourself.
I Have: A tiny glimmer of hope, its slim, but there is a way out. This is good because I sure as hell didn't have this, this morning and its now a reason to smile.
I Need: This is funny to hear from the therapist today as I explained my past relationships - "with every thing that is going on this must be a very lonely time for you." and "As soon as your ready I encourage you to find a partner" Odd. Very Odd. But its true I do need someone in my life. But more than that I WANT someone in my life. I need to get my life in order, one day at a time. I need to get over my fear, because this situation is very frightening to be in, my parents are in a bad situation, I'm in a not so good situation, and it is frightening. Now I need to stop being afraid of my landlady.

I don't think I need to go into further digression here. But this covers the basics and now I am waiting to find a therapist that I can see on a regular basis and get more things worked out. Also, its time to take charge once again. I'm a stubborn and tenacious woman its gotten me through life so far, and its time to bring that back to the forefront.  Cause once I do, nothing will be to hard to handle.

I don't write nearly as much as I should. I guess none of us really do anymore. Life gets ahead of us and we just don't stop to do anything about it anymore and its sad. So here is an entry - and I wonder how long before anyone of my friends reads it.

So whats going on in the world of Michelle? It really seem like not much, but sometimes its just a bit overwhelming. The most recent crisis has been boy related. After Geoff I have taken a hiatus of sorts from dating. I have dated occassionally and its turned out ok. But really just feels like a huge waste of time sitting through a meal with no hope of ever seeing the person again.  I have picked up another male friend, for the necessity of taking care of mother natures urges towards pro-creation without actually pro-creating. Thats one headache I don't need at the moment. So for the most part I'm avoiding guys in a relationship sense. 

Though enter the new roommates Allen and Roberto. Both nice guys and it seems like Roberto has developed a crush on me. Ok this violates the roommate code somewhere. I just know it does! He saw fit to tell me that he likes me and ok my radar is going on the fritz and I'm freaking out because I don't want to hurt anyone and well hopefully I nipped this in the bud because its just NOT going to happen. Though honestly I think things are going to be ok with the three of us. If not well we'll see what happens. As for the rest of the guy problems: Mark is moving out in less than a week and internally I am doing cartwheels and screaming hallelujah! This kid is the absolute worst roommate I have ever had next to Scott in college! 

Then enters Abhishek. This is one man I can't wait to meet. A guy I met totally by chance via the internet. We'll have been talking for 4 years come March or April we started chatting during the my first semester at NECI. Awhile ago we started talking in more or less a romantic sense and that stopped once we both started seeing other people. I need to get some veggies or make more glaze to go with the chicken because as it sets it gets a better flavor. Gotta love roasted chicken recipes. Food is good!

The Year of Magical Thinking - Joan Didion

Water for Elephants -

I fell asleep late last night...nothing unusual there. I was watching Harry Potter and got interrupted twice with phone calls. So I just finished watching it later than I wanted to. But the odd thing is I had the weirdest dream last night. I mean honestly I dreamt about two of my ex's (Bill and Hector) and a friend (Jeff McKay). The only one I ever talk to is Hector and occassionally Bill when he is in the mood to be slightly chatty. And I haven't talked to Jeff since April I think.

So here is the dream as much as I can remember a few hours later.

It starts out with me hanging out with Bill, and things are going ok. Though in my dream Bill is like he was in high school and we were dating. It was very close and very intimate. Though I am exactly the same person I am now. Very strange. We were sitting in his room and talking and out of the blue he asks me "do you love me and only me?" In order to spare him hurt feelings I tell him yes and start kissing him. After a few moments, I get up to go to the bathroom. When I walk out  the door I walk into Hector, literally. Again this is the Hector from when we were dating, not the friends that we are now. This scene is reminiscient from when I came home from VT and was waiting for him to come home from work, and he came into his apartment and pulled me onto his lap and just held me tightly. I am remembering Bill whom I had just left in the previous room when Hector kisses me and tells me he loves me and that there is no other person in the world for him, and I am torn, because I do care about Hector deeply and I tell him too that I love him and want him. He pulls me upstairs and halfway up his hand becomes Jeffs.  (This is where it gets odd because I have never had the slightest inkling of emotional attachment to him) we go into Jeff's room and he pushes me onto th bed and starts undoing my shirt, saying the same thing that the other two have said and to be fair I tell him that he is the love of my life, though I am lying through my teeth because I don't want to hurt him, since he is my friend (again he is a teenager). After a few moments I am back with Bill, and feeling extremely guilty for lying to him and knowing that if ever finds out he is going to be hurt. The same thing happens with Hector and Jeff. I run out of the room and they all end up chasing me and cornering me, but before anyone could say anything and make me out for a liar I wake up.

Thats it.

I am so tired, I couldn't sleep last night. I couldn't figure it out. But this one topic no this one word kept resonating in my head. "Alienated" Yep thats the word, and the subject of this posting. 

Almost two weeks ago, Geoff and I were hanging out and I asked him sarcastically, if his friend Jenn would actually meet me now that we are no longer together. And he replied that he didn't see why not as there was no way for her to feel alienated (obviously this is not a direct quote, but close enough). I laughed - and thought to myself - how the hell did she feel alienated? Since then that word has be going through my mind. I rarely get obsessed by anything, but I was furious in that moment, and realized that I was still mad at him. So I ended up writing him a 6 page letter, telling him why I was mad at him, and it was a very freeing, I literally felt the anger drain away. But something tripped me off again last night. And I realized that if Geoff ever decided that he wanted to get back with me, that I just can't do it. 

Because he alientated me from his life. I remember the day he told me that he was looking for rollerblading partners, and that he was going to meet Jenn. That was the day he drew the line between us, that I was not allowed to cross. If I had to choose a time when our relationship started to fail, it would be that day. I could not understand why he wouldn't want me to be a part of that section of his life. I still can't. But I no longer need to understand. I tried to cross that line time and time again. Then when I couldn't I tried to rationalize it and pretend it wasn't there. I spent so much time being angry and jealous of Jenn, and it had nothing to do with her at all. I couldn't understand why I was jealous and angry everytime he talked to her on the phone, hung out with her. Out of all the relationships I have been in this is the first time I have ever been jealous of my boyfriend hanging out with his female friends, and now I know why. Because I am not a jealous person, my behavior and reactions scared me. 

Obviously I have to wonder, because by his own admittance, that past girlfriends have had problems with him hanging out with his female friends. I wonder if he has drawn that invisible line with them as well. If Geoff is trying to find a woman that will accept this line being drawn in their relationship and being alienated from his life, well I highly doubt he is going to find her. And I am afraid that he is going to be unhappy in his relationships until he realizes what he is doing.

Personally I am amazed at myself right now, amazed that I am not crushed or devastated by this. Especially since I was trying to figure out what the hell was wrong with me, and it had nothing to do with me at all. I'm not ready to date yet, but I am still ok with me and I am ok with being with me. With all the shit that was going on, I wasn't able to recognize something so simple, and being in love, I would of done anything (within reason) to work things out in our relationship. But a relationship takes 2 and both have to be invested in it. The day that line was drawn, I believe I was the only one still invested in our relationship. 

I'm not mad at him, but at least I am not going to be letting him rent space in my head. I want to be friends, I care about him deeply, the only way you can care about someone that you were once in love with.

I just got off the phone with Hector and I haven't felt this good in a few days. I needed his cool sense of making things right. One of the things I cherished during our relationship and our frienship previous to that. I have let too much stuff get into my head. Especially from mom and dad, as always. I am thinking of getting back into therapy. I am not perfect and speaking with psychologist might help me deal with stuff that I had thought that I had already dealt with. Guess what I haven't. Nothing new there. 

I'm tired, so tired and frustrated and I need to write more later, I don't think I want to ruin this good mood.

Tonight was fun, I went and saw the movie United 93 with my friend Jay. Interesting movie, though I am thinking Flight 93, which was a made for television movie based on 9/11 is much more emotional. But that movie was portrayed through the eyes of passengers whereas this one comes from the views of the people who were trying to figure out what the hell was going on.

But on my way downtown I called mom and dad. Yay for free weekend minutes. And they asked me how my new job is going. Quite frankly, its very annoying. Because I am totally not satisfied with what I am doing. Dad says that I won't ever be satisfied with what I am doing until I own my own business. But I don't think that is true either. I have been wondering about my choices for a career a lot lately more so than in the past. I know I am not happy doing what I am doing I get tired of it very easily. Somedays I wish I could go back to Bar Harbor and work for Lou again - despite personal issues that is the one place where I was satisfied with my work. It was simple direct and creative all at the same time. All I had to do was prep, plate two hundred or so appetizers, salads, and desserts, clean up and call it a night. Boom ba da bing. Done. Now I feel like even that would be too much to handle. But I honestly can't help but wonder if dad might be right. Or if getting my Masters Degree would be the right choice. Or if I have made any right choices concerning my career. Its not that I expected to be further along, its that I expected to be happier with my career choice than what I am. Hope and Rhonda have asked me time and again why I don't go back to school, for journalism, which is what I wanted to do in the first place. Rhonda even asked me when we were up there a couple of weeks ago. I love working with the people and I love helping make everything special for their special day - being part of something that I never thought I really had a chance at until I met Geoff. 

I can't wait for Geoff to get home he has to wait for the shuttle to take him from point a to point b since the train is being worked on. Its been worked on for the last three Saturdays. How annoying. He went to shoot some pool with his friend Jenn and they stopped to see a show together. I just wish he were home. This whole thing about my career has me thinking to much and I need some distractions. Unfortunately Penny doesn't cut it. Even though she is an adorable puppy. 

So to you my friends - what do you think? Be honest with me. Be brutally honest, it might piss me off, it might make me want to call you and yell at you. But I won't. My mind is so muddled right now about my future it is almost depressing. I am happy with every aspect of my life expept this. If you ask me what I am passionate about - food is top of the list obviously. But this is also coming from someone who was a binge eater through out her childhood. Ugh I don't know and my head is going to explode! I know you guys can't tell me what to do, but some advice, criticism, thoughts, anything at all would certainly be welcome.

Christmas is over....time to breathe a huge sigh of relief. In comparison to past Christmases this was definitely one of the best ones that I have ever had. Though getting woken up early by Livia knocking on the door to open presents . . . .this must be a preview of what it is like to have children. I got some pictures so those of you who read this regularly keep your eyes peeled as there will be some pictures coming your way soon. Yesterday was also the first day of Chanukkah. My first Chanukkah. It was very nice and very homey and simple. Livia lighted the Menorah with her Uncle and they sang the blessing together. After that it was on to more presents. As I am not Jewish myself the last thing I expected was to be fully integrated into the tradition, but Geoff's Aunt and Uncle (Pat and Norman) gave me a beautiful lavendar candle which is going to be going in Geoff's and my new kitchen. We finished off the day at China Sky for dinner and it was yummy. Last years Christmas while not the best wasn't exactly horrible either, with mom and dad in Florida and Hector came out and spent the night. Supposed to have been on the living room floor on the air mattress instead we ended up sharing the bed. I didn't sleep I was so uncomfortable. This year, was beyond wonderful the only thing missing was my own family. I miss them a lot and find that I miss them more now than I have in a very long time. Maybe it was the visit in October, or who knows. I certainly don't.

So here it is the day after Christmas, I'm at work and its quiet which is nice and I am spending time in reflection of the past years, as I have a tendency to do every year. It seems to me that after a certain age Christmas just loses its charm and excitement it becomes a holiday of blah blah blah. Well this one was definitely different as we sat and watched Livia opening her presents, I can't remember the last time I laughed so much at Christmas. It was great, I am going to go to CVS after work today and see if I can't make some copies of the pictures I got on my camera to frame. Geoff and I both want to frame the one of us together at his place, and the one with us and Livia is just great. I'm going to put that one here in the frame at work.

I am sitting here in Needham and the last two days have left me feeling, I am not sure if its exhausted, no not exhausted but feeling kind of let down. And its not because of anyone else that I am feeling this way its because of me. My mind feels like its going a hundred miles a minute and I am frustrated since I can't seem to make heads or tails out of what is happening right now. I am the happiest I have ever been but I have this cloud of doom hanging over my head. And it all has to do with money. Money Money. Goddamn pieces of shit paper that have zero meaning beyond what people give it.

I have ten dollars left to get me through till Thursday and its more frustrating than ever now. I feel like crying my eyes out I feel so bad because of this. I may not have the most perfect job in the world but I don't want to have to find another one so soon. I hate that I can't seem to get myself out of the low end jobs that are the part of where I am. I have so many more skills then this. Jesus Christ Stefanie has bought herself a fucking mustang. I am not sure on how successful my other classmates are but I can almost guarantee that they are doing better than I am. I often find myself regretting my decision to go to NECI or even being in this business. Granted I am doing well for myself, but at the same time I am barely squeaking by. Today, today I went with Geoff and his mom to look at the places he wants to potentially buy. The one on Summer St is gorgeous if a little unconventional and the one that is out a little ways further is even nicer I think - except for the green bathroom. When Lois was talking to Steve the broker about a couple of things, I felt myself being insulted by a couple of her comments. 1) Cheap - in regards to formica counter tops and 2) No taste, when it came to vinyl siding. I wanted to ask her if its cheap when you can barely afford it, and how is vinyl siding no taste when its a huge step up from roof shingles on the side of the house? I know she is really trying to get the best for the money and that she coems from an entirely different life than I do. Thats not a problem, but she also needs to remember that it isn't in bad taste or cheap. In fact the formica is somewhat more suitable for a kitchen, granite in the kitchen would be wonderful but it isn't a necessity. I am finding that it doesn't matter to me what the house looks like that is really up to Geoff. But what I saw with each of those places we were looking at and I asked myself in everyone of them...Can I call this home? Can I be happy living here with Geoff. And honestly these two places were the only ones that in my mind were Yes to both questions. Then I find my mind drifting - Geoff and I have agreed that I will pay the utilities. No problem it will be a hell of a lot cheaper than rent! Except in the case of heating oil in the winter, but if he is willing to help out on that then it will be alright. But for me its going to be a fight as always to keep things financially balanced. 

What is bringing on all of this is that my student loans are off of forebearance, and they are now 30 a month cheaper than my rent! Hence the reason that once again I need to find another job. You think that after all of the changes I have made in my life it would be easy to just pack it up and move to another job and to another house. But this time it isn't easy. I have already uprooted my life so many times to make it better and it seems like that just putting a band aid on it and its falling off, and it keeps falling off and nothing is getting better it feels like it is only getting worse and worse and worse. And I want more than anything to move in with Geoff and live with him and be happy ever after, but how can it be happy ever after if I am always broke trying to put my life together. Why must I always try to put my life together this is just bullshit. I am tired of fighting with money and have bill collectors call me and I can't seem to get myself out of debt. I can't seem to keep things from getting worse. Maybe they have to get worse before they get better. I dunno. I am so sick of this. 

I have to remember, I am crossing the boundries into the more sophisticated side of the world, and I hope that I can survive in it.
